reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great-it is right in front of the main shopping street and within walking distance of everything. The staff were very nice and helpful when we asked about things to see & do. Our room was very big and quite comfortable (but dark) and the bathroom facilities were fine. The breakfast was lovely-lots of nice salamis, cheeses, etc. I would say it is a good value hotel as its reasonably priced-I have definitely stayed in nicer places but this was perfectly fine and suited us for our weekend stay in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money
Avoid at All Costs
reviews.text: I stayed at the des Arts for a couple of nights on the return end of a business trip. As other reviewers have stated, the hotel location is decent and the staff are friendly. That's the extent of the positives. The hallways and rooms are kind of dingy and smelly and my room was subject to a lot of street noise. The pictures at the hotel's website are misleading and make the rooms look better than reality. The hotel charges 4% to use a credit card and the advertised internet access (an old PC in a room adjacent to the lobby) is another fee. As another reviewer reported, I also was told that I couldn't get in after 2am or so. I didn't take the chance, but this sure seemed weird. Finally, breakfast was the standard Northern European fare of cheese and meats, but the selection and quality was a level below what you'd expect for the price of the hotel (although the coffee was good).

Based on recommendations here, we booked a "quad" room for a single night in July to spend a day in Amsterdam before heading home after a 2-week trip in Europe. Upon arriving at the Hotel des Arts we found the location to be great and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room was up several flights of narrow, winding steps which was somewhat expected -- we didn't expect the smell of urine in the hallways though! Our room was a small with a fold-out couch and a single bed on the "1st" floor and an improvised loft built into the ceiling with a double bed (accessed by a stairway that was closer to a ladder). The room was not very clean and there was little air flow. That night the real trouble started -- the loft area was about 90 degrees and felt more like Panama than Northern Europe since there was no fan and only a small window. Our two children, who were excited about sleeping the loft, gave up after two hours of tossing and turning in the heat. I agreed to sleep upstairs and about 1am finally fell asleep "in the tropics". In the morning I awoke with about 20 mosquito bites that I guess were from mosquitoes that had flown in through the small window in the roof. We really are troopers and none of this would have mattered had this been a $50 a night "roughing it" night which we've done many times before. The room, however, cost us just under 200 Euro or about $240 so our expectations were obviously much higher. There are many, many better hotels in Amsterdam for that price. Don't stay here.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: After reading several Trip Advisor reviews, decided to stay here which we did from November 17-21. The canal view room was very large, with high ceilings with wood beams, a fireplace(non-working), sitting area and a couch. Windows were floor to ceiling. Closet space was good and bathroom roomy. Hotel is centrally located between Centraal Station and the Leidesplein. Trams stop right outside of hotel which is two blocks from the Rembrandtsplein and the Flower Market. Breakfast which was included, was standard continental fare. Overall it was a good experience and fairly reasonable by Amsterdam standards. If you are looking for a quiet room, don't reserve the canal view although the noise outside wasn't too bad. Be advised that if you pay by credit card they charge you a 4% fee. Only problem we had was getting new towels daily, even though we followed standard towel etiquette. (Towels on the floor means we want new ones). This hotel does not have an elevator, but that is part of its charm since you are staying in old Amsterdam building. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a true old Amsterdam experience.

We celebrated my mother's eightieth birthday in early September by spending a few days in Amsterdam and stayed in four rooms at the Hotel des Arts. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower/bathrooms were utilitarian but not cramped, with plenty of hot water. All the staff we met were extremely helpful, and pleasant. On the day of my mother's birthday, the champagne we had brought was put in the refrigerator in the kitchen, and at 6pm, the front of house staff put out glasses and napkins in the hotel living room and we were able to have a private drinks party. No one could have been more helpful, and we would reccommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient and laid back
great location
reviews.text: Just come back from a weekend away in Amsterdam staying a the hotel Des Arts. The hotel is a clean but basic hotel, no tea / coffee facilities or hairdryers in the room, the rooms were of a decent size however our room was on the top floor accessed by a very steep spiral staircase, not good after a few drinks ! There are no lifts. Its location however was brilliant , right in the centre of the city just a 20 minute walk from the central station ( or 5 minute tram ride which stops right outside the hotel ) with all attractions easily within walking distance. The staff were also extremely helpful.

reviews.title: Cheap clean and safe.
reviews.text: Hotel is above average but only for this price range, if you are looking for a really nice hotel stay at the Canal House. I stayed at the Arts Hotel in Feb 2002 I think they have made some improvements since then but I could be wrong. Anyway at that time I found the hotel to be great value, I stayed in a single which was of a good size although the public phone was outside the door and was constantly in use by loud American's telling the world how stoned they where! My only grip was my friends had a lovely large room facing the canal which is worth the extra cost, however, my friends had not made aware of the extra charge so they had to pay more than they where quoted, too stoned to complain!
